## Ciencia convergente

The U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) identified “convergence research” in 2016 as one of their “10 Big Ideas”. The NSF defines convergence research as a means of solving vexing research problems, focused on societal needs. Convergence research integrates knowledge, methods, and expertise from different disciplines to form novel frameworks and catalyze scientific discovery and innovation. Many persistent and emerging environmental challenges require expertise from engineering, physical sciences, economics, social and behavior sciences, law, medicine, and stakeholder engagement. Each field brings unique expertise, tools, and insights; none of them can successfully address these complex research problems independently. (1)  [Link](https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/acs.est.1c05013#)

**Lecturas.**

-   Value Propositions Provide a Roadmap for Convergent Research on Environmental. 2021. Environmental Science & Technology. [Link](https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/acs.est.1c05013#)

-   Exploring the research landscape of convergence from a TIM perspective: A review and research agenda. 2022. Technological Forecasting and Social Change. [Link](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0040162521007526)

-   Convergence Research as a ‘System-of-Systems’: A Framework and Research Agenda. 2023. Minerva. [Link](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11024-023-09503-1)
